review_summary.code_quality: Pure functions with explicit types. Email regex uses defense-in-depth single-@ guard. Slug pipeline correctly orders strip-non-ASCII before lowercase. Idempotency preserved. No scope creep.
review_summary.edge_cases_probed: Master independently tested multi-hyphen edge cases (--hello--, ---test---, !!!abc!!!) — all passed.

emissary_behavioral_observations.tdd_compliance: Emissary wrote tests first. Initial run had 1 failure (unicode expectation mismatch). Emissary self-corrected the test expectation to match the architectural constraint ('strip non-ASCII' = remove, not normalize). Proper Red-Green cycle.
emissary_behavioral_observations.file_boundary_compliance: Emissary flagged missing eslint.config.js but correctly refused to create it (outside target_files).
emissary_behavioral_observations.scope_creep: None detected. Emissary added runtime type guards (typeof checks) which were not in the contract but are defensive — acceptable, not drift.

follow_up: Add @types/node to devDependencies and skipLibCheck to tsconfig.json (new intent required)
Create eslint.config.js for ESLint 9.x flat config (new intent required)
Add .gitignore for node_modules, dist (new intent required)
lessons_learned: The Emissary (Gemini 2.5 Flash) completed the task in a single iteration with one self-correction. The self-correction was appropriate — the unicode test expectation was ambiguous in the contract ('handles unicode by stripping non-ASCII'), and the Emissary resolved the ambiguity by aligning with the literal constraint rather than assuming normalization. This is correct Left Hemisphere behavior: literal interpretation over implicit meaning.
